Yes, PitchCar: Stunt Race includes support blocks, ramps and track joiners – along with suggested circuits – that create a two-story race structure that will undoubtedly have your car sailing far beyond the rails as you gun the engine up the ramp.

Note, too, that the box cover shows a ramp support being placed in the center of the base level of track, providing an extra challenge on the ground – should working your arm through the supports in order to reach your car not be enough.

Expands:

PitchCar (but not Carabande)




Buy Microbadge
38677.name: PitchCar: Stunt Race

boardgamehonor.9137: 2008 Årets Spel Best Adult Game Winner

38678.name: Novem
38678.description:
(From the publisher's site. Translated from Norwegian.)

The object in Novem is to score more points than your opponent. There are numbered tiles of wood on the board in three rows and three columns - where one player controls the rows and the other the columns. In secrecy the players choose a row and column, and the attacking player takes the tile in the intersection between the selected row and column. Then the other player become the attacker, and so on. At the end of the game the player whom have collected the tiles with the highest numbers the most points! A totally brilliant tactical game!

Novem - ein Taktikspiel für 2 Spieler – einfach, aber brillant!

Wer schafft es, nach zwei Partien mehr Punkte zu erzielen als der Gegner? Auf dem Spielfeld liegen neun Zahlensteine in je drei Reihen und Spalten. Ein Spieler kontrolliert die Reihen, der andere Spieler die Spalten. Geheim wählen die Spieler in jeder Runde eine Reihe und eine Spalte aus. Der Angreifer gewinnt den Stein, der am Kreuzungspunkt der ausgewählten Reihe und Spalte liegt. In der nächsten Runde wird der Gegenspieler zum Angreifer.

Novem ist ein taktisches Spiel, für das Sie keine mathematischen Kenntnisse brauchen – aber einen klaren Verstand und Nerven aus Stahl!

38679.description:
In Tenka, each player takes the role of a local baron in the chaos of medieval Japan. The Emperor is powerless and the office of his sworn protector, the Shogun, is an empty shell. The realm is in turmoil as rival Daimyos struggle for control.

Two to four players compete in this fast-playing card game of consolidation and conquest, where each turn and every card play is a decision whether to PLACE a card in your court for a modest but long-lasting effect, or to PITCH a card for a stronger but single use.

Nobunaga realized his ambition and united almost a third of Japan under his rule; only one player can seize enough Provinces, or have all three Regalia, to control the realm. Play Tenka to find out if it will be you!

Each game covers one period of unrest in Feudal Japan lasting until a great warlord emerges victorious
38679.name: Tenka

38680.name: Boochie
38680.description: Like Bocce Ball but playable indoors. First toss the target, a foam dodecahedron. Then try to toss your ball and ring as close as possible, making your tosses with various challenges. Players placing closest get 1 or 2 points ... first to 11 points wins!

38681.name: Sauve-qui-peut
38681.description: Be the first player to reach the safety of your boat. To escape the centre fortress you must climb onto the shoulders of another piece.

38682.name: High Finance
38682.description:
High Finance is one of six pencil and paper games described in the Sid Sackson book, Calculate! .

Players advance through a series of game spaces and record the impact on their Net Worth according to the type of space they land on. If the space simply designates one of four industries (Oil, Steel, Auto, and Food), then the player has gained control of one additional company in that industry and this tracked in a designated area of the scoresheet. Upon landing on a "Profit" space, the player’s Net Worth is multiplied by a percentage amount that rises for controlling multiple companies in a specified industry. Similarly the impact of landing on "Loss" space for an industry will be scaled according to the player’s holdings.

A mathematical operation is performed on the calculator for each player’s turn. Examining the resulting display determines whether the player moves 0 to 3 spaces, although the player sometimes may have more than one choice to select from. Game ends when all players have exited the sequence of spaces, highest Net Worth wins.

38683.name: Travel America
38683.description:
Travel themed trivia game about the 50 states of America. Game length is variable, depending on the starting and ending points players decide to travel.

Gameplay from box:
"Turn over a mileage card and the adventure begins. When you land, you answer a question about the state you land in. Get it right, and you go on -- collect your money or miles, but get it wrong and you pay. If you're the first traveler to reach the destination and you haven't gone bankrupt -- you win!"

38684.name: Maze Master
38684.description:
An updated take on the venerable wood maze and steel ball Labyrinth. Its dual pivot frying pan design, though, allows for single hand control.

"When you think you have it mastered, rotate the maze or switch hands and discover a completely new challenge!"

38685.name: Dinosaur Land
38685.description: Very simple roll (or, in this case, spin) and move children's game with a dinosaur theme. Ploddingly advance your dinosaur up the rainbow colored path to the finish line, hoping to avoid hazard spaces.

38686.name: Sadowa
38686.description:
Sadowa covers the one day battle (spread over 13 turns) between the Prussians and the Austrians (and their Saxon allies) during the 1866 Bohemian campaign. Standard game (4 pages of rules), and a more advanced game with setup information (an additional 4 rules pages) with simultaneous plotting and some minor changes to the core system. Units represent infantry, cavalry, and artillery. Rules cover combat (ranged fire and close assault), line of sight, terrain, stacking, zones of control, redoubts, reinforcements, superior Prussian morale, optional Prussian Command, and Austrian "Kamikaze" Hussars!

Sadowa is a rather simple tactical design, with amateur production values, die-cut counters, and a color 22 x 14 inch map. Published by Fusilier Games (Aberdeen, Scotland), this game game was un-boxed (zip) with a cardboard cover sheet.

38687.name: Go for the Dough: The Game of Word Meanings and More!
38687.description: From the Box: "Go for the Dough is a fast-paced, vocabulary building and word meaning (semantics) game for children Ages 4 and up. This highly motivational board game helps children improve their word recall, word knowledge, describing skills, semantic flexibility, and phonemic awareness skills.

38688.name: Automany
38688.description:
Automany - The road hazard game

(Resume of the game from the publisher)

The Automany game consists of an unending road on which players travel by car and experience various misadventures. When on the way a player loses his car, he must get another one immediately either by purchasing or renting. He pays the registration fees along with the insurance premium and then resumes his way on the game board.

For the most audacious players who like to take chances, the game gives opportunities to launch into business (business squares) and eventually make money. But beware, the richest player is not necessarily the one who wins; a player without money, who succeeds in keeping his car till the end, has many chances to win.

38689.name: Spy Gear: Spy Wire
38689.description: Race against the clock to neutralize detonators and deactivate the explosive before it blows! In this fast-moving, suspenseful strategy game, players slide the wire tiles to make connections between their defuser and their opponent’s pegs, close the circuits, and deactivate their fuses. Comes with an electronic countdown timer and explosive sound effects that create sudden-death endings if you make the wrong move. Live to spy another day…there’s not a second to waste!

38690.name: The Moor was Covered in Blood
38690.description:
A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played on a 7.5x5 foot table using miniature figures mounted two per base. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are also provided for use with the rules.

“The decisive battle of the 1745 Jacobite Rising took place at Culloden in April, 1746. The English army had been strengthened by reinforcements from the continent, and well trained by the Duke of Cumberland. They were well prepared to fight the Jacobite forces of Prince Charles. The Jacobites were outnumbered, low on supplies, and poorly led in the battle. They were subjected to a deadly artillery barrage, and outflanked by the English. The battle was a disaster for the Jacobites, and ended the rising.”

38691.description:
Orginally published as Ismerd meg a lovagkort! ("Get to know the age of chivalry!") this Hungarian game is now available in an expanded version, sold also under the name of Lovagor - Itt te vagy a király! ("Age of chivalry - you are the King!")

Home Page: http://integraljatek.hu/html/lovagkor%20tarsasjatek.htm
38691.name: Lovagkor

38692.name: Se hva jeg kan!
38692.description:
(From the box - translated from Norwegian)

Se hva jeg kan! (See what I can!) is a trivia game for the smallest children.

There are many things which needs to be learned and set in systems. Here the children learn of concepts, language, spelling, rhymes, numbers, seasons, weekdays and colours in a fun way.

The game is designed for children who has not started school yet, and prepares the child for the concepts that is used in school. Some questions may be easy for your child, but the game also contributes to the child getting conscious of it's knowledge and the concepts it is based on, and gives a experience of mastering. The game demands an adult to participate.

boardgamehonor.9270: 2008 Årets Spill Best Children's Game Nominee

38693.name: Konkurrer med vaskebjørnene
38693.description:
(From the box - translated from Norwegian)

Konkurrer med vaskebjørnene (Raccoon wash)

Come and join in the fun and hectic cloth wash chaos! The raccoons try to recover the right t-shirts for their sets of cloths from the washing machines - the player first player to find the t-shirts on his/her three secret tiles wins the game. But... on the way to the washing machines your raccoon have to find the tiles that is needed to open the right washing machines. The raccoon may also find a lucky joker tile or get a chance to have a peek into one of the washing machines. Who will be the first to recover the right t-shirts for their set of cloths and win the game?

38694.description:
GODZILLA: KAIJU WORLD WARS will recreate all the action with the kaiju of the famous Toho (licensed) movies. Kaiju will battle kaiju . . .and humans . . . to destroy cities and each other. This will be the first in a series of games that will all be playable by themselves but will add new and different kaiju to the series, as well as enabling players to "build" bigger cities. The games will include figures of the kaiju as well as building pieces to give players a great 3-D visual effect, as well as enabling them to destroy all those buildings. The game uses a unique Battle Card system to resolve combat. The first game will include Godzilla, Gigan, Rodan and King Ghidorah.

GODZILLA: KAIJU WORLD WARS will be fast, furious fun fighting game for ages 14 and up . . . with a playing time of one hour or less.
38694.name: Godzilla: Kaiju World Wars

38695.name: Speedway: World championship formula
38695.description:
This title is presumably from the early 1970's.
Production number 15504.

The box cover shows a drawing and signature of Ole Olesen, the Danish world champion in speedway.

The game has borrowed the player pieces from the Swedish Tuppa Speedway, but the actual gameplay and board is very different.

The board has depicted a 4 lane track in an oval form (as is the case in speedway) which are again divided into squares. Some of the squares are coloured in one of 6 colours - and the colours determine what happens if you land on them. One game lasts for 4 rounds, as in real speedway, but there are additional/optional rules for both team and league play.

38696.name: Niko
38696.description:
(From the box)

Niko, Julius, Wilma and Essie have gone out to play. They slide down the Icy Slide and suddenly end up on the lands of the Black Wolf – help them find a way back home!

You move freely on the game board by rolling the die. After finding two of your animal character’s treats from underneath the snowdrifts, hurry towards the Snowy Steps – but don’t let other players’ animals snatch your treats, and beware of the Black Wolf! The first one to reach the Snowy Steps wins the game.

38700.name: kippl
38700.description:
An abstract game combining piece elimination strategy with memory.

Players mix 12 tiles of their color face down in a square pattern and then reveal 2/3 by flipping them face up. The player with the fewest face up tiles in his color goes first. Each move consists of a die roll followed by the move of either one of his face up pieces or a face down piece in a series of horizontal or vertical hops onto other pieces or stacks of pieces, which ends by flipping the moved piece, and removing the piece (if any) the moved piece was on top of when it started. Players who cannot make exactly the number of steps rolled with any legal piece must pass. Once all players have passed, the game ends and the player with the most visible pieces his color wins.

38701.description: From the box: Play Butterflies Are Free and you won't be catching butterflies ... you'll be setting them free! Move around the cool game board and see who'll be the first player to let these brilliant butterflies go. but the game's no walk in th park! Land on "Take 2 butterflies" and you have to add more to your collection.
38701.name: Butterflies are Free

38702.name: Sink the Bismarck
38702.description:
A simple solitaire dice based game where the player takes on the role of the Anti Air coordinator on board the battleship Bismarck, while under attack by the British Swordfish aircraft.

Player tries to predict path of incoming aircraft and place gunfire into its path.

Counters indicating imcoming aircraft are placed and moved down the board while the player uses anti aircraft dice to indicate anti aircriaft gun fire.

The game is freely web published under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike license.

http://blackdogofdoom.blogspot.com/2010/09/sink-bismarck.htm...

38703.name: EVE: Conquests

5614.name: CCP Games / CCP hf (Crowd Control Productions)

38703.description:
EVE is a hard-core sci-fi setting, ruthless, cruel, and cold. Set twenty thousand years in the future, the game world presents a human race straining at the boundaries of its own nature. Massive empires have risen to envelop vast areas of space, each aiming to shape the universe according to its own unique vision.

EVE: Conquests is a strategy board game for 2-4 players set in the EVE Universe. Players assume the roles of the four major empires in EVE and set out to prove their superiority by means of planetary domination. Their conquests require them to play the political landscape in EVE, an effort that often leads them to make war on those who defy them. Garnering the influence necessary requires tact and strategic management of resources in all spheres of operations.
It normally takes about 2 hours to play the game to completion.

The game is based on a highly successful computer MMORPG EVE Online.

38704.name: Gilroy Garlic Game
38704.description:
From the back:

"Welcome to KFAT country. That great and wonderful expanse that stretches south from San Francisco to Salinas, possibly even King City. Where the U.S.A. comes out of the Pacific and across to the mountains that make San Joaquin a valley.

"A land of virtually everything that could be wanted (except good snow). A place to raise the spirits of man, perhaps his income.

"A land of farmers, ranchers, fishermen, electronic engineers, country people, suburbanites, cowboys, etc., etc.

"A mini-world offering a great variety of terrains and activities. All this within the grasp of one centrally located city. Gilroy! Yes, Sir! It's all within 50 miles of the Garlic Capital of the World.

"This is the game that plays over the area and enables you to pit your investment skills against others in a race to return big dollars.

"Players will be buying and selling agri-commodities and learning all about the necessity of cash flow.

"No need to worry, it's not complicated just business as usual with a KFAT twist.

"They're all real businesses that exist in the area, encompassed by San Jose, Santa Cruz, Salinas, Hollister and "all the rest of them there towns down there". So welcome to the heart of it all, Friendly Gilroy."

38705.name: El Juego del Capitalismo
38705.description:
"El Juego del Capitalismo" Is a Colombian boardgame designed by two economists.

The objective of the game is to learn how to manage your money.

There are several roles/professions in the game (Construction Worker, Lawyer, etc...). At the beggining of the game each player select a profession, each profession has a monthly income and outcome and the board represents the life of a person in an abstract form.

The players roll a dice advance that number of spaces and take the correspondent card. Some cards are oportunities other are unexpected events and expenses and so on...

The game ends when the first player obtains his/her profession goal.

As said nobody looses, nobody wins. The goal of the game is to learn how to manage your money.

38706.name: Ne engedj a negyvennyolcból!
38706.description:
On March 15, 1848, mass demonstrations in Pest and Buda enabled Hungarian reformists to push through a list of 12 demands. Faced with revolution both at home and in Vienna, Austria first had to accept Hungarian demands. Later, under governor Lajos Kossuth and the first Prime minister, Lajos Batthyány, the House of Habsburg was dethroned and the form of government was changed to create the first Republic of Hungary. Initially, the Hungarian forces (Honvédség) defeated Austrian armies. To counter the successes of the Hungarian revolutionary army, Franz Joseph asked for help from the "Gendarme of Europe," Czar Nicholas I, whose Russian armies invaded Hungary. The huge army of the Russian Empire and the remnants of the Austrian forces proved too powerful for the Hungarian army, and General Artúr Görgey surrendered in August 1849.

Ne engedj a negyvennyolcból! is a card game based on the theme of political unrest and the Hungarian freedom fighters during this turbulent time in Hungarian history.

38707.description:
In Bushido: Der Weg des Kriegers (the subtitle means "Way of the Warrior") players take on the roles of Daimyo, feudal lords in medieval Japan, and compete to become the next shogun of the empire, who gets appointed by the emperor. And this truly has to be an honorable man.

Basically this game is all about resource management and conflict, but unlike other games in this category you won't necessarily win, if you conquer the most areas. Your main goal is to earn enough honor, which can be achieved in different ways. There are two kinds of honor. 'Daimyo-Honor' is the victory condition and can be directly gained by holding provinces, and indirectly by transforming 'Samurai-Honor' at a set rate. 'Samurai-Honor' is gained by winning a defensive or offensive battle. It can be transformed into 'Daimyo-Honor' with a tea ceremony.

The first Daimyo who earns 50 points of honor wins the game. If this goal is not reached within 12 turns, the Daimyo with the most honor at that point wins the game.

What needs special mentioning is the turn mechanism of the game, which is really cleverly-devised: depending on the number of players, different 'offices' are in the game that get assigned to the players. In a 4-player game these offices are:

Daimyo: The active player. For clarification: in game terms, every player is a Daimyo, but only the active player acts as Daimyo. The Daimyo, as active player can restock his resources, attack a province and play special tiles. Most importantly, he assigns the other offices to his opponents.

Samurai: The general. He will lead the attack in the Daimyo's name. He can earn 'Samurai-honor' with a successful attack.

Bushi: the poor guy who is attacked by the Daimyo. He can earn 'Samurai-honor' with a successful defense.

Sensei: He gives council to the Daimyo. Tricky position, because his council can do the Daimyo harm or good. He can cancel an attack, spy on other players, use Ronin to destabilize a province, and suggest to the Daimyo how hard to punish his Samurai when he loses a battle.

The battles are resolved by a system that depends on the number of troops and a rock-paper-scissors element. The opponents have the possibility to improve their odds by investing some of their resources.

The tricky part of the game is that most of your actions depend at least partly on the goodwill of one of your opponents. For instance the Daimyo depends on the Samurai to win, but the Samurai will only do this, if he sees enough gain for himself. This makes the game very interactive, with much discussion and haggling at the table.
38707.name: Bushido: Der Weg des Kriegers

38709.name: Raid Fiat 128
38709.description:
Raid Fiat 128 Game by Editrice Giochi

2 - 4 Players.

Description

The aim of the game is to complete the course with the smallest number of penalties.
The Course consists of 128 sections marked by small yellow triangles. - Each Represents 20Km.

Cars may overtake only on broken white lines - They must stay behind otherwise!

The game includes gear cards, radio cards and weather cards.
Watch your speed on the bends or face penalties.

Adverse Weather Will Affect Your Journey.

All Signs Must be Obeyed.

The Automatic Panel Feature is a Great Design Feature - To See How Far You Travel(Instead of Dice) -

Take a Gear Card,Engage the Gear on the Automatic Panel and Turn the Wheel Until the R.P.M Indicator Shows What the Card Reads.

The Speedometer Will Then Show How Many K.P.H You Can Move -

E.g - Card Reads - Gear 1-11 RPM 2700.

Select Gear 1-11 on Panel,Move Wheel to 2700 RPM - Speedo Shows 20Km/h - You Can Then Move One Section.

Contents

1 Course Board.

4 Fiat 128 Miniature Playing Pieces.

1 Automatic Panel.

1 Pack of Gear Cards(34).

1 Pack of Radio Cards(18).

1 Pack of Weather Cards(10).

1 Pack of Tickets(30).

1 Set of Instructions.

38710.description:
Age of Muskets Volume II: Eagles Rising
"Eagles Rising" is the second volume of our Age of Muskets Series, it covers Napoleon's Campaign in Northern Italy 1796-97. There, Napoleon made a name for himself and earned the prestige that would put in his hands the destinies of France and, eventually, of Europe.

The Campaign started with Bonaparte's offensive in the spring of 1796 that knocked the Piedmontese Kingdom out of the war and subjected it to French power. Then followed the struggle against Austrian attempts to relieve the besieged Mantua, and retake the Po River Valley that led to the Battle of Rivoli in January 1797. Finally with Napoleon's offensive in the spring of 1797 that led to Leoben (on the road to Vienna) and, eventually, to his victory over the First Coalition.

As in Volume I the game includes all the elements that characterized pre-industrial warfare. However, the player will also find some elements distinctive of this campaign, as Alpine terrain, a different map and time scale to reflect the duration of the campaign as well as certain historical details (the systematic looting by the French, the revolts against French occupation ...). Given the size of the armies involved most of the scenarios of this Volume are quite adequate for two players since there are few headquarters and their size is quite manageable.

However, the game title would be incomplete if it referred only to this first campaign of Napoleon. The box also includes the necessary counters and scenarios to play the Austro - Russian counteroffensive of 1799-1800 that ended at the famous Battle of Marengo, the first that Bonaparte fought and won as First Consul of the Republic after his return from Egypt.

Marshall Suvorov and the Russian Army, with their Austrian allies, expelled the French from all their Italian conquests. Bonaparte's counterattack in 1800 came after Suvorov and Russia retired from the conflict but, what if things had been otherwise? You may explore this exciting possibility in the Napoleon vs. Suvorov scenario.

Each game contains:
- 2 70x50 cm maps (together form a 50x140 cm map of northern Italy, Switzerland and Germany)
- 8 battlefield terrain overlays
- 2 sets of Player Aid Sheets (3 sheets per set)
- 2 HQ Display Sheets
- 2 ten sided dice
- 1 set of Army Sheets for photocopying
- 832 counters (4 counter sheets)
- 1 “Age of Muskets Series Rules" booklet
- 1 Eagles' Rising booklet including special rules, scenarios, historical notes and designer notes.
Eagle's Rising is not just a game, it's a whole gaming experience including 6 battle scenarios (Rivoli, Marengo, First Zurich, Second Zurich, Novi and Trebbia) and 11 campaign scenarios, ordered by increasing complexity, from the 2 turns of "Piedmont's Defeat" to the full campaigns of 1796-97 and 1799-1800. This includes Suvorov's campaign in Switzerland and a hypothetical campaign pitting Suvorov against Bonaparte!!!!

It will be possible to put together Volume II with the next in the series: "Vienna or Death" which deals with the campaigns of 1796-97 and 1799-1800 in southern Germany with Moreau vs Archduke Charles in action.



[En Espanol:]El juego está en inglés pero encontrarás en esta página (Apoyo al Jugador) los archivos en español necesarios para jugar –Hojas de Ayuda, Reglas y Escenarios.
38710.name: Age of Muskets Volume II: Eagles Rising

38711.description:
Conquer the ancient China!

China 300 BC. Several emperors fight for the country. Each one tries to connect villages to his area in order to gain power and influence. Yin and Yang has to be in balance.

Each player tries to lay down paths to connect villages to his area. While placing paths, he collects black and white pieces, Yin and Yang. For each pair of Yin and Yang he can buy cards. The cards can either be a task to connect two villages which gains points or a special-card which allow several special actions. The player with the most correctly connected villages wins the game and will be the new emperor.

For 2 - 4 player ages 10 and up, 20 - 30 minutes playing time.
38711.name: KaiZa

38712.name: Anomalies of Love
38712.description:
Anomalies of Love is a game about love and relationships. The game starts when players meet their special someone. As they get to know each other better they can focus on the 8 things that their relationship can rely on, the things that hold the couple together – matching sense of humour, mutual outdoor hobbies, mutual intellectual hobbies, similar values, mutual dreams for the future, memories the couple have together, matching music taste and of course sex. The more they find in common in each other the more points they get.

The game proceeds by players placing tiles on the board. Both the tiles and game board have symbols for these 8 things that relationships can consist of and players try to match the symbols on tiles to those in game board.

However every tile also holds an evil promise. A chance for mistrust, a black heart that represents all the bad things in relationships. As player's tiles approach one another these black hearts become both something that jepardise your own relationship, but those of others too. If two black hearts are placed next to one another, then the one that was there first gets turned 45 degrees. If it can't do that or gets disconnected from the structure the tile is removed and relationship just lost some of its charm. In other words the way you place those black hearts at the beginning of the game can matter a lot. You need to build your relationship to withstand the bad times – make it into something so strong that even when shaked, it won't break.

There is also Agenda -cards that can alter the strategy each players has. In the end the player who has the most perfect love life will win the game.

38713.description:
Time's Up! Edición Amarilla (Yellow edition) is a new edition of popular Time's Up! game

Is party game for teams of two or more players. The same set of famous names is used for each of three rounds. In each round, one member of a team tries to get his teammates to guess as many names as possible in 30 seconds. In round 1, almost any kind of clue is allowed. In round 2 no more than one word can be used in each clue (but unlimited sounds and gestures are permitted). In round 3, no words are allowed at all.

This edition is in spanish language
38713.name: Time's Up! Edición Amarilla

38714.name: UNO: Get Hooked
38714.description: This edition has custom images of the University of Texas at Austin campus and Longhorns athlectics, each of the 112 cards celebrates the orange and white. Includes the exclusive Hook 'Em Card and Rule.

38715.name: Domino 32
38715.description:
DOMINO 32 are playing cards based on Chinese Dominoes. There are 32 cards in 16 pairs, which then can form a 4x4 matrix. They are available in gold and silver decks. As is the cards can be used to play Pai Gow, Tien Gow, Bagchen or any other game played with Chinese Dominoes.

Also available is a booklet called Domino 32 Card Games which includes the rules for 9 additional games: 16 Pairs, Bigger/Smaller, Cosmo Turtle, Dragon Dance, Heaven #9, Fair Lady, Pyramid, Concentration, and Challenge.

38716.description:
In a land being explored by frontiersmen and soon to be settled by pioneers, as valuable a resource as nature ever provided man is a steady stream of fresh water from the flow of mighty rivers and their vast tributaries; in The Great Divide, it is up to players to see that nature favors their side in the flow of that water to the oceans.

Representing the American West and the Pacific Ocean or the vast plains of the Midwest and the Gulf of Mexico, players must shape the directions of these winding Rocky Mountain Rivers as they flow on their ocean-bound course to their destiny in forging a great nation.

In this classic ‘Euro-style’ tile placement game, the challenge of tile selection and placement presents the players with enjoyable puzzles on a truly grand scale and, while subtle to master, The Great Divide can be learned and enjoyed by players of all ages and skill levels.

Game Components:
• One 4-page, illustrated, full-color instructions booklet with Variants and a Scoring Example
• 72 1” die-cut hexagon-shaped River tiles
• 20 Selection and Events cards
• 1 8.5” x 11” game board of the Rocky Mountain region of North America

Game Mechanics: Tile placement employing strategy in both the selection and placement process
38716.name: The Great Divide

38717.name: Peg Top
38717.description:
All children find great amusement with a SPINNING TOP of any character, together with the use of PEGS in recording scores in games. This novelty has been prepared with this in mind. First, the Top is Spun and when "dead" the handle points to one of four numbers. A Peg is then inserted in a Hole at one side of the board to register the player's score and the first player having PEGGED IN over his course of 30 HOLES WINS.

(From the instructions. All capitalizations are as they appear in the rules.)

The game is very basic. It has a shallow metal cup in the middle of the board. You spin the top in the cup and when the it stops, the player the top's peg is pointing towards gets a point.

boardgamehonor.21180: 2010 Charles S. Roberts Best Board Game Graphics Nominee

38718.description:
(from GMT website :)

Normandy '44 is a 2, 3, or 4-player, regimental level game of the D-Day landings on June 6th and the battles that raged in Normandy for the next 21 days. During this crucial period the Germans had their only chance to push back the Allied invasion before the preponderance of Allied men and material made the outcome certain. During this period, the U.S. 1st Army fought across the Cotentin Peninsula and captured the major port of Cherbourg while British forces took on the bulk of of the German panzer divisions near Caen.

The game uses a simplified Ardennes '44 system: Move, Fight and Reserve Movement. All non-tank battalion units are rated for Troop Quality, while all armor units have a Tank Rating. In each battle these ratings are used to provide shifts for either the attacker or defender. Other important shifts are provided by air power, naval support, artillery and/or Tiger tanks.

The game includes a 22 turn Campaign game, a 7-turn Tournament Scenario that focuses on the Allies linking up the beaches, and a scenario covering the battle in the peninsula and the capture of Cherbourg. In addition, there are rules for allowing 3 or even 4 players to play the game.

Game Scale:
Turn: 1 day
Map: approx 2.3 miles /3.8 km per hex
Unit: Battalions to Brigades

Game Contents:
One 22 x 34" map
Two countersheets (456 9/16" dual-side printed counters)
One 32 page rulebook
Two Combat & Terrain Player Aid Cards (2 sided)
Four Set-up/Reinforcement Cards (three 1-sided, one 2-sided)
One 6-sided dice

Complexity: low to intermediate
Playing Time: 3 hours
38718.name: Normandy '44

38719.description:
This game portrays the actions surrounding and involving the series of PQ (Scotland to Murmansk) convoys in the Second World War. The map covers the area of the Arctic Sea where the action took place.

PQ-17 appeared in JagdPanther magazine #8, January 1975 (along with the game Barad-Dur, 3430). It has amateur DTP production values. Many different types of ships are represented including Battleships, Cruisers, Destroyers, Merchants, Anti-Submarine Trawlers, Tankers, Escort Carriers, and of couse Submarines and U-Boats.

Employs a written movement orders system. There is a tactical board for combat. Rules for weather, fuel, British Home Fleet, convoy scattering, ice pack, airpower, ASW screens, torpedoes, and crew rescue are included. All this in just 4 pages of rules, plus 1 page of charts.
38719.name: PQ-17

38720.name: Felhőfogócska
38720.description:
The checked-eared rabbit (known from the TV show) blows soap-bubbles that show different characters and scenes from the series, also clouds that have the same shape as these characters. The game offers different rule versions in which children have to find out which cloud has the shape of which character, or which three bubbles are connected to each other; it also can be played as a memory game for children above a certain age.

Home Page: http://www.kockasfulunyuljatek.hu/rovat/3/felhofogocska.html (Hungarian)

38721.name: Patkány-póker
38721.description:
In this game rats in 2 to 6 colors (from the movies Macskafogó - Cat City - and Macskafogó 2.) race on the board (one player has 2 or 3 rats of the same color and type). First they have to collect casino tokens and then go to the five face-up canasta cards (showing scenes from the second movie) to collect them for tokens. On their way they can also use rat-holes for faster travel. In the easier version (for smaller children) number of steps is determined by dice rolling, in the 'heavier version' players choose from their 6 movement cards (and after 6 rounds they can use all of these movement cards again). In the easier version you get points for tokens (different tokens have different value) and for collected cards (cards with cats have a higher value than other cards). In the heavier version you bid for the cards you have come at, and score for the cards' value and extra points for pairs and trios...

Home Page: http://www.macskafogojatek.hu/ (Hungarian)

38722.description:
The students of the haunting school at Shiverstone Castle are very excited as the final haunting exam takes place today. The little ghosts have to prove that they know they are asters of their trade. Whoever pays close attention and displays a bit of skill, will be able to frighten lots of the castle inhabitants and undoubtedly pass the exams.

An eerily nice collection of games for 2 to 4 little ghosts Ages 4 and up.

This is a collection of 3 games requiring the players to move a ghost within Shiverstone Castle, using a magnet underneath, to find and frighten its inhabitants.
38722.name: Mini-Schlotterstein

38723.description:
(This paragraph paraphrased from the Module.)
This module contains material for the Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition game system. To use this product you must have Star Fleet Battles Tournament Book 1991 or later. You will also need the Star Fleet Battles Basic Set. To use some portions you will need Advanced Missions, Module C1, Module C2, Module J and/or Module K.

This 32-page book consists of over a dozen chapters covering tournament tactics for specific tournament cruisers. The chapters, in order, cover Federation, Klingon, Romulan, Kzinti, Gorn, Tholian, Orion, Hydran, Andromedan, Lyran, Wyn, and ISC tactics. There is a final chapter that covers general tournament tactics.

Each chapter has articles written by aces, staffers, and/or unrated players. These articles were published without extensive editing with the intent to accumulate more material and feedback that would be used in a later 1993 publication for Star Fleet Battles.
38723.name: Star Fleet Battles: Module D2 – Tournament Tactics

29663.name: Star Fleet Battles: Captain's Edition Basic Set

38724.name: The Rigelian Wars 2146-3705
38724.description:
The Rigelian Wars 2146-3705 represents the series of wars fought between the expanding Rigelian Empire and the collapsing Altair-Mizar Dynasty.

The game consists of a series of "mini-games" which are referred to as "wars". Each of these consists of an indefinite number of turns. Separating the wars are special "peace periods" during which construction of new ships and redistribution of forces takes place. The turns within the wars consist of movement and combat phases.

Rigelian Wars is an amateur early DTP (mimeograph) that contains a 4 piece (8.5 x 11) map, two strips of unmounted counters, and 6 pages of rules. Three scenarios, low-complexity, fairly standard wargame mechanics, production, warp (and hyper-warp) movement, ground units, and a Cobalt Bomb that destroys everything in the target hex!

38725.name: Allerheim 1645
38725.description:
Allerheim 1645 (also known as Second Nördlingen) is the second Thirty Years War DTP (after Nördlingen 1634) privately released by designer Ben Hull.

Part of the Musket & Pike Battle system, this release ended up being polished and published by GMT in Under the Lily Banners (see that title for more specific game and system information).

Large (32 x 20) single piece map, unmounted color and b&w unit counters (note: these have a 'top-down' view), 2 pages of b&w status markers, and numerous charts and tables.

Issued as a ziplock with a black & white cover sheet.

38726.name: Medici
38726.description: From the Author: "Medici is a set of rules for wargames in the Renaissance era.This set of rules is designed for use with 25mm Miniatures.It can be used to fight battles in the Thirty Years War, the English Civil War, and for Renaissance warfare."

38727.name: The Red Book of Nal
38727.description: Magic in the Acqittaine series by Carl Smith. Provides rules for use in the " Sword and Shield" series.

38728.name: Asphodel Inn
38728.description: " A complete fantasy adventure set in the world of Acqutaine". For use with the rules "Sword and Shield".

38729.description:
Gorlice-Tarnow covers the Eastern Front in World War 1, 1914-1916. Includes troops from Russia, Germany, Austria-Hungary, Turkey, Serbian, Rumania, Greek, Bulgaria, Italy, Britain, and France. The map (15 x 35, in 6 sections) stretches from Riga to Odessa. Each hex is 25 miles, and each turn a week.

The unique Army Group Command Control system prides itself on simulating "the utter stupidity of WW1 Generals." Six pages of rules cover standard wargame mechanics plus railroads, entrenchments, forts, subject peoples, political consequences, neutrals, weather, and sea transport. Scenarios are included for the campaigns of Lemberg, Gorlice, Brusilov, and a WW1 variant of Drang Nacht Osten!

This game was included in JagdPanther magazine #7 (which was an oversized issue). It has amateur DTP production values. Rather large for a magazine game of its time!
38729.name: Gorlice-Tarnow

38730.name: Palazzo
38730.description:
"Welcome to Renaissance Venice! The Duke of Venice wishes to grace his city with beautiful new palazzos dedicated to science and art. Players are artisans employed by the Duke, and the player who builds the most impressive structures will win the game and gain immense honor in the Duke’s court. [This game is based on Dirk Henn's Alhambra]"

Game System

Piecepack Game System

38731.name: Spiel-Satz-Sieg
38731.description: Accurately conceived according to the rules of tennis Spiel-Satz-Sieg offers; everything that is in a tennis match: hard hit balls, unreachable returns, solid hits that affect the opponents ability to return. On the board are marked the ways to acquire good position in order to make solid returns. A point scale keeps track of current points for the game.

38732.description:
The Classic Just Got Better!

Will "the Guard" take the hill at Waterloo this time? Wellington called the battle "a near run thing," and in fact, many of the battles of the period were just that... close affairs that tilted on a key decision or a critical error.

Now, LBG gives you a chance to explore some of those great battles, with an evolution of a proven system. From Battle™ the American Civil War , now comes, Battle: The Napoleonic Wars™. Pick a battle, or make up your own — you have 24 geomorphic hex tiles, printed on both sides for a multitude of possible battlefield combination. Pick an army—you have five major nations to choose from, plus minor allies, each with the full range of troop types that make the period so interesting... each troop type offering different strengths or weaknesses. Use historical scenarios, explore the "what might have been" of great campaigns, or use a "points’ system to build your own optimal force.

The diceless combat system means it all depends on your tactical skill... to know how unit strength compares with terrain advantages and enemy capabilities. You may groan at an error, but you’ll never wail about bad die rolls—the results are entirely up to you and your opponent.

(Game description taken from Lost Battalion Games Website)
38732.name: Battle: The Napoleonic Wars

38733.description:
The Aliens are coming!

The X Deck is a not-entirely-serious expansion for Uwe Rosenberg's Agricola, to be released through Spielbox magazine in German and through Lookout Games in English.

The October 15, 2008, issue of Spielbox magazine includes a standalone add-on deck (in German) for Agricola that’s been dubbed the “X-deck.” The deck includes 24 cards of 5 different types (Alien Actions, Merchants from Outer Space, Alien Artifacts, Alien Events, and Alien Occupations). Art for this expansion is by Klemens Franz, the same artist who did the work for Agricola.

The aliens arrive when the players create a Quarry; that is, when the "1 Stone" card from Stage II of the game (Rounds 5-7) is revealed. Whenever a player takes this action, they also draw the top card from the Alien Encounter Deck (X Deck). (Note that this does not apply to the "1 Stone" card that appears during Stage IV (Rounds 10-11).) Of course, you also take any Stone that is on the space.

An English edition of this expansion has been available directly from Lookout Games and can be obtained by donating to a fundraiser via PayPal. It is also available via Agricola: The Goodies Expansion.
38733.name: Agricola X-Deck

38734.name: Plus 4
38734.description:
Plus 4 looks like Connect Four. But here every piece coming back down pawns in the same column. Each column contains only 4 pieces. A fifth pawn pushes out the last pawn.

There are two ways to play. Either you decide that the first alignment has won, or you play continuously by scoring a point for each new alignment.

Contents :

a game grid.
9 red pawns.
A bright red bonus pawn.
9 blue pawns.
1 light blue bonus pawn.
An instructions sheet.

38735.description:
Based on the novel by Frank Schätzing, continuing the Kosmos line of literature-based games. The world is facing an ecological catastrophe caused by previously unknown marine life forms. Each player represents a nation sending their scientists out to confront the threat.

The action cards form the core of the game. For each round, the cards are shuffled and placed in a row. Each player in turn order takes the leftmost card from the row, until there are no more cards left. Instead of the leftmost card, players can also buy a different card by paying with victory points.

At the end of each round, players score points according to the sizes of their largest research networks. At the end of the game, extra points are given out based on whether research stations are connected to the center of the game board.
38735.name: The Swarm

38736.name: Fire the Cannons!
38736.description:
Fire the Cannons! is a tile laying game where players compete to build the largest castle, while strategically using cannon fire to ruins their opponents' castles. Its a Euro-style game, no die rolling for mechanic resolution. Playing the tiles builds your castle, situates the cannons, and when a sufficient number of flag-tiles are played, fires the cannons.

Starting with the player holding the cannon and proceeding clockwise, each player should take one territory
tile from the face-up pile in the center of the board and add it next to another tile in their kingdom.
The tile may be rotated when being placed.
Only when an area is completely enclosed by walls, however, is it considered “secured”. If an area has one or more gaps, it is considered “under siege” until all of the gaps are filled.
Each tile will generally have one or more special symbols on the tile. Adding three commander (red flag) symbols to one’s kingdom will trigger a round of attack. The player will score during this time as well.
At the end of the round, refill the center play area with new tiles from the territory tile stack
The player with the highest score when no tiles remain in the center of the play area wins.

Is freely available from http://www.vbasementgames.com/ after you create an account.

38737.name: Henchmen
38737.description:
Congratulations! As the new franchise owner of a Henchman Unlimited agency, you provide the needed help for many of the world’s most discriminating major villains as they implement their evil plans. Survivors often claim that the experience is quite rewarding! But beware those doomsday plans…

You have to complete missions set by the major villains. The first player picks the plan the villain wants accomplished, and then the players play henchmen to try to complete the mission. They commit henchman to resolve the evil plan. Players take one henchman card from their hand and commit it face down. These henchmen form the mission pool.
All Players Simultaneously Reveal Henchmen in the Mission Pool. All the better to determine which henchmen to undermine … er … help… during subterfuge. Players Play Subterfuge Cards. These cards can help and hinder in the efforts. Then you see whether the plan worked. If the plan succeeded, then the highest unique number on the henchmen will count for points (be promoted to the back office).
You repeat till 3 rounds or a doomsday plan has been completed. If a doomsday plan was enacted, then the player whose henchman made it succeed is ineligible for victory.
Each eligible player totals up the henchman value for all henchmen promoted to the back office. The player with the highest total is the winner. Players may tie for victory.

Available from: http://www.vbasementgames.com/
You have to create an account to download the game.
2014-05-23 update: The website vbasementgames.com no longer available

boardgamehonor.9271: 2007 Årets Spill Best Children's Game Nominee

38738.description:
(Translated from the box - from Swedish)

Lilla Tjuv och Polis engage the whole family and is just as fun to play for the older children. Here everybody gets to act as police and chase the quick footed robbers back and forth over the unique three dimension game board. To fill the cell with five naughty robbers is no match for the sharp minded. The important thing is to remember which robber has been nice and which to apprehend. Find and catch all five robbers - fast, before they escape again!

2007 Nominert til Årets Barnespill - Nominated for Children's Game of the Year, Norway
38738.name: Lilla tjuv och polis

38739.description:
Rally Point Volume 1 is theme based Advanced Squad Leader scenario pack from the publishers of Schwerpunkt. All 10 scenarios focus on actions that contain Axis Minor units, so you can get more use out of Armies of Oblivion.

RP1 Ferenc Jozef Barracks - Hungary January 12, 1945
Romanian units attacking a Hungarian unit in Budapest.

RP2 Kerepesi Cemetery - Hungary January 11, 1945
Russian Pioneer unit attacking a Romanian unit with supporting Stug IIIGs in Budapest.

RP3 Varismajor Grange - Hungary January 22, 1945
Hungarian infantry and assault guns counterattack Russian units in Budapest.

RP4 Transylvania 6-5000 - Romania September 19, 1944
Hungarian infantry and assault guns attacking Russian units and T-34s outside of Lippa Transylvania.

RP5 The Horvath Interlude - Russia January 18, 1943
A Hungarian motorized battalion attacks Russian infatnry and armor units outside of Alexeyevka.

RP6 Cadets and Cadre - Romania September 17 1944
Hungarian armored division attacking a hill defened by Romaina infantry and at guns.

RP7 Romanian Hammers - USSR October 26, 1942
Romanian mountain divsion with assault guns attack Russian infantry units outside the town of Nalchik.

RP8 Well Taught - Austria April 12, 1945
SS Panzer Grenadier units attacking Soviet and Romanian infantry and armor outside the town of Hohenruppersdorf.

RP9 Shelling the Sivash - USSR April 8, 1944
Russian infantry and armor, supported by partisans, attack a mixed unit of Romanian and German infantry and armor in the Crimea.

RP10 Slovak Salvation - Ukraine November 8, 1942
Ukranian partisians attack units from a German/Slovak security division outside the village of Lojev.

Expands:

Advanced Squad Leader
38739.name: Rally Point Volume 1: Axis Minor Special Study

38740.name: Krokofant
38740.description:
Are you able to puzzle together a zebra or an elephant? Or maybe a Krokofant (Crocodile/Elephant)! What new animals can you figure out? A game full of fun and learning with wooden blocks, animal cards and die.

First form the four animal-puzzles by randomly placing the 24 wooden cubes on the table 6 cubes for each animal.
Each player gets 4 cards one of each color.
In his turn player rolls the dice and may turn as many cubes in different posittions as the dice indicates.
If one of the puzzles shows the animal player has on his card he may turn tha card face-down.

Player with the 4 face-down cards in front of him is the winner.

boardgamehonor.12912: 2008 Vuoden Peli Children's Game of the Year Nominee

38741.name: I Am, I Do
38741.description:
(From the box - translated from Norwegian)

A fantastic mime game for children. Can you imagine a giraffe dancing or a tortoise playing a trumpet? In this mime game you have to act out many crazy and hilarious things. Throw the coloured die which decide who you are and what to do. Afterward you act out what the die wanted you to do, and the other players try to guess what you are acting. If somebody guesses correctly, both you and that player move forward on the board. If you are lucky the spinner will permit you to move forward faster. Be careful when laughing! If a player laughs at the player acting, he/she must move backwards on the board. The first player to reach the finish wins the game.

38742.name: Lost at the Zoo
38742.description: Help! The animals are loose at the zoo. As a Zoo Keeper, it is your job to gather your animals and get them back to their habitats. Be the first to get them back and become the head Zoo Keeper.

38743.description: Be quick sailing around the island. Act quickly when the wind dice roll and the wind changes direction. If you end up on a whirlpool you can even ask for help from the weather god... but who knows if he'll respond positively or negatively. This is just one of the possible surprises of this exciting sailing game.
38743.name: Gegen den Wind

38744.name: Hide-N-Seek Under the Sea
38744.description: Welcome to Hide-N-Seek Under the Sea. It's a race to find all your fish friends and get back to your home before your opponent does. Sounds easy, right? Well, all you have to do is make it past Cranky Crab, Mrs. Jellyfish and by all means - stay away from the fist nets!! So let's play Hide-N-Seek Under the Sea.

38745.description: Umbria is a Age of Steam map specifically designed for two players. The game was designed by Sergio Roscini and is print & play.
38745.name: Age of Steam Expansion: Umbria

38746.description: Age of Steam: Alpha Centauri - A New Hope is a map specifically designed for two players. The map was designed by David Turner and is downloadable from BGG.
38746.name: Age of Steam Expansion: Alpha Centauri – A New Hope

38747.name: Accused! Getting Away With Murder?
38747.description:
How will you fight for your freedom?

Welcome to your worst nightmare...

A murder has been committed and you stand Accused! The race is now on to clear your name. Create your own alibi and then head into town to make it airtight.

Will you play nice, or will you play nasty? Will you make friends and cut deals or will you bribe, mug, and even murder witnesses? It's up to you to choose just how far you'll go to prove your innocence.

The final battle takes place on the courtroom floor. Will your defense case hold up? Will you convict the right person? Or will the true killer still be among you...Getting away with Murder?

38748.name: Elan Deluxe
38748.description:
Elan Deluxe is the latest version of Phillip A. Jones' tactical Napoleonic miniatures wargaming rules. Elan is designed to have each player controlling roughly an augmented division of troops.
Élan Deluxe is the latest and final evolution of these tactical-level Napoleonic wargame rules designed for 15-25 mm miniatures.

The Deluxe version also includes campaign rules Etat-Major, new optional rules, and also included in the rules are extensive unit ratings for over twenty nations and over 40 Army lists for every nation that took part in the conflict including multiple theatres.

Élan is a flowing game that accurately reflects historical tactics. Players are placed "on the table" and granted wide historical latitude to control their units.

The rules sequence features both simultaneous and alternate actions, resulting in an intuitive and balanced game that captures the feel of the period strongly. Individual units represented are the battalion and regiment and players can do sub-unit actions such as company and squadron actions. Players can use any basing system and the default scale is 1:50, but players can use any ratio such as 1:20 or 1:60.

It is a game that replicates the tactics of the period and enables gamers to play the period and not get bogged down in complex rules! The game can also be adapted for other Horse and Musket periods from the SYW to the Crimea War.

The game will appeal to players who enjoy tactical nuance and want a game that grows with them in subtlety and tactical complexity. Élan is written in a clear, concise style. The rules are well indexed, logically laid out and easy to comprehend. The PDF file also has bookmarks for ease of navigation and players can print out just the sections that interest them.

38749.description:
Germany was founded in 1949 and reunited in 1989. Therefore, the year 2009 will be Germany's 60th birthday and the 20th Anniversary of the Reunion.
Klaus Teuber and the Kosmos Verlag wanted to do something special for this event and will bring out this gorgeous version of their Catan game.
It will feature a map of Germany, designed by Michale Menzel, and some slightly simplified rules. You will be able to build city landmarks as for example the 'Brandenburger Tor' or the 'Dresdner Dom' in one of the 12 possible cities. All these landmarks will be in the box as plastic miniatures of significant detail.
In short: A must have for all German Catanien and a good addition to the collection of every other wood-for-sheep-enthusiast.

On the box: Discover and settle germany!
Explore and settle the storied land of Germany using the elegant, award-winning game design from The Settlers of Catan. Here, you will find great social interaction, simple rules, beautiful German geography, rich history and lore, and 12 wonderfully-sculpted landmarks.
Catan Geographies: Germany is a game about trade, building, and settlement. Start with town halls in 3 cities. Then build roads to neighboring cities, where you can purchase landmarks and new town halls. Town halls create resource production, while the unique landmarks generate special awards. Both yield victory points - as do the Longest Road, Largest Army, and historically-based victory point cards.
So, have fun with friends or family while casually discovering the novel geography and history of Germany.
38749.name: Catan Geographies: Germany

38750.name: Fill the Flower Pot!
38750.description:
From the rulebook:
Whoever, with a good overview and a bit of luck, can bring the
three flowers to the flower pot of the corresponding color first, wins the game

This is one of Haba's "Suitcase" games: small childrens games in a metal suitcase suitable for travel (all magnetic pieces).

38751.name: Number Detectives
38751.description:
4 games in one:

1. The Plus-detectives
Whoever is savvy and has lots of luck will collect the
most number cards.

2. Quick Plus-detectives
Play according to the rules of Plus detectives, except for the players calculate all at once.

3. The ten times table detectives
Whoever is savvy and has lots of luck will collect the most
number cards.

4. The speedy ten times table detectives
The same rules apply as in the “Ten times table detectives”,
except all players calculate simultaneously.

38752.name: Downward Spiral
38752.description:
Downward Spiral is a sole survivor board game, developed by researchers at the Institute of Behavioral Research at Texas Christian University. The game provides substance abuse counselors with an innovative way to motivate clients and open up discussions about the consequences of addiction on themselves and their families. In a game format that resembles the well-known Monopoly™, players roll dice to move across a board filled with potential downfalls related to family, health, friendships, finances and self-esteem, which are described on game cards that players draw. The objective of the game is to stay alive, without losing all social and financial resources due to substance abuse -- a task that becomes more challenging the longer the player stays in the game.

The Downward Spiral game focuses on the consequences of substance abuse on a person’s family, finances, self-esteem, health, legal status, and life expectancy (or lack thereof). Each player takes the role of a person who continues to abuse drugs throughout his/her lifetime. The last player left “alive” in the game “wins.” The game uses vignettes as well as facts and quotes to emphasize the consequences amassed in the game. An after-game discussion helps focus the players on issues that have surfaced during play.

More information can be found here: http://www.ibr.tcu.edu/pubs/trtmanual/downwardspiral.html

38753.name: The Game of Oppression
38753.description:
While college campuses are becoming increasingly diverse, many students still find it difficult to step outside of what is familiar and interact with students of different races, religions, classes, abilities or sexual orientations. Students may pass each other on campus and attend classes together, but few develop meaningful relationships with others from different backgrounds. The Game of Oppression is designed to encourage and challenge individuals from different backgrounds and experiences to engage in authentic dialogue.

The Game of Oppression Diversity Education Kit includes:

The game board

Facilitator Guide

Instruction Booklet (with Reflection Journal and Observation Worksheet)

Six decks of cards

10 colored pawns

One die

How it works:

The Game of Oppression is designed to be played by 10 to 20 players at a time, with half playing as active participants and the other half as observers. The optimum amount of time allotted to play is four hours to ensure proper facilitation and personal engagement, but the game can be played in a minimum of three hours. The goal is to achieve "enlightenment." To do this, the active participants move their pawns around the game board and respond to statements on the playing cards. After a set period of time, the two groups switch roles. At the end of the game, all players participate in a reflection and group discussion period to synthesize the game experience for each participant.

More information can be found here: http://207.97.193.139/index.asp?PageAction=VIEWPROD&;ProdID=28

38754.name: Fare på ferde
38754.description:
(Translated from the box - in Norwegian)

Fare på ferde... a preventive game from Røde Kors (Red Cross).

The game that teaches.

Fare på ferde is a fun and entertaining family game that should teach the players common sense regarding both bathing and walking in the mountains in a new and exiting way.

The game takes place on a journey through the Nordic countries. The various routes will give unexpected experiences. In this way you learn what dangers nature may offer and how you should behave.

Fare på ferde is a different game, both informative and preventive. The game gathers players in all ages for entertainment about a serious theme.

Bon voyage

38755.name: College Basketball Dynasty
38755.description:
From the Rules:

"Have you ever wanted to build a basketball dynasty to rival that of Wooden’s legendary UCLA teams? How about experiencing the thrill of recruiting, developing and a starting a team of Champions? What about trying to improve a run-of-the-mill team into a tournament team, all while trying to keep your job? You can do all of these things a more in Basketball Dynasty—in under an hour.

College Basketball Dynasty is a game about recruiting and developing college basketball players, while trying to qualify for the tournament and win a championship. Each player acts as the head coach of a college basketball team and has 12 years to win as many games, go to as many tournaments and win as many championships as possible. As the coach, you determine who to recruit (do you want solid season performers or the star who can win in the big game), who to develop, who to start and bench, and what style of team do you want (e.g., a group of 'team players' or bunch of talented 'individuals' who happened to play on the same team)."

Components:

1 Six-Sided Die
1 Rules Book
1 School Rating Chart
1 Coach Record Sheet
14 School Roster Boards
25 Red Chips
150 Blue Chips
168 Player Counters (General Supply)

38756.name: Sheik
38756.description:
(Translated from the box - in Norwegian)

Sheik
- a game about the oil

Come and join the oil adventure on the North Sea. A game about speculation in share and oil drilling.
Contents include money, shares, oil rig contracts, chance cards, insurance policies and roulette.
A game for everybody Ages 10 and up.

38757.name: Bugs
38757.description:
From the back of the box: "A fun numbers game that can be played by all the family. The object of the game is to score the most points by placing/matching the bugs in the best way."

Players take it in turns to place tiles so that edges match, and they score points according to how many dots are on the relevant bugs. An egg-timer is included to speed up play.

38759.description:
Tygrysy w śniegu (Tigers in the Snow) is about battles fought on foregrounds of Kharkov during winter 1942-1943.

The game uses rules of the B35 (Battles of World War II 1943-1945) system designed for dealing with medium battles of World War II. Counters represent battalions (Germans) or regiments (Russians), one hex represents 1500m, one turn represents 12 hours.
38759.name: Tygrysy w śniegu

38760.name: Battle of Trafalgar (1805 AD)
38760.description:
“The decisive naval battle of the Napoleonic era occurred when a British fleet of 27 ships under the commander of Admiral Horatio Nelson engaged a Franco-Spanish fleet of 33 ships. Nelson devised a daring strategy to overcome his opponents. He divided his force into two squadrons, which attacked the center of the Allied fleet at right angles. Nelson led one of the squadrons into action aboard the Victory. The plan was a smashing success. The Allied fleet was crushed, losing twenty ships. The British didn't lose any ships, but a French sniper killed Nelson. This battle ended forever Napoleon's dream of invading Britain, and the Royal Navy would dominate the seas for the next century.”

A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played on a 7.5x5 foot table. Free print-and-play paper miniatures (flats) are provided for use with the rules. The rules cover fouling, grappling, boarding, cannon fire, drifting, and wind effects.
Colored yarn is taped around the edges of the game table to give a quick visual guide to the effect of the wind based on the color a ship is facing. “If the ship is pointing towards the green then the wind is behind the ship . . . If the ship is pointing towards the yellow it is close quartered . . . If a ship is pointing towards the red then it is ‘locked in irons’” and must pass a skill roll to move.

38761.name: Redmond Trivia
38761.description: Localized trivia game about Redmond, Oregon. Roll and move your way around Redmond answering questions about its rich heritage.

38762.name: PaloaltoOpoly
38762.description:
Another community adaptation of the venerable parlor game.

"Become the wealthiest resident of Palo Alto while forcing all other players into bankruptcy and you are the WINNER!!!"

38763.description:
[EN]
11 de Setembre 1714 is a game based on the battle that took place in Barcelona, in September 11th 1714. One player (or team) controls the army of the Two Crowns (France and Spain), and the other (player or team) commands the Catalan army, which defends the city of Barcelona.

The game is divided in different turns. Players alternate moving their units and attacking the enemy on each turn, having as an objective, the defeat of the opponent and the control of strategic areas.


[CA]
11 de Setembre 1714 és un joc basat en la batalla que es produí durant l'11 de setembre de 1714 a Barcelona.
Un jugador (o equip) controla l'exèrcit de les Dues Corones (França i Espanya), i l'altre (jugador o equip) comanda l'exèrcit català que defensava la Ciutat Comtal.

La partida està dividida en una sèrie de torns, en cadascun dels quals els jugadors s'alternen en el moviment de les seves unitats tot atacant l'enemic, amb l'objectiu de derrotar les forces del contrincant i controlar el màxim d'espais estratègics.


[ES]
11 de Setembre 1714 es un juego basado en la batalla que se desarrolló durante el 11 de setiembre de 1714 en Barcelona.
Un jugador (o equipo) controla al ejército de las Dos Coronas (Francia y España), y el otro (jugador o equipo) comanda el ejército catalán que defendía la Ciudad Condal.

La partida está dividida en una serie de turnos, en cada uno de los cuáles los jugadores se alternan moviendo sus unidades y atacando al enemigo, con el objetivo de derrotar las fuerzas del contrincante y controlar el máximo número de espacios estratégicos.
38763.name: 11 de Setembre. Setge 1714

38764.description:
SHUURO The game of creative chess.

Shuuro allows you to choose your own ‘chess army’ before every game, so that each player will have a different set of pieces. The obstacles on the board also change position every time you play, ensuring that each game will present new challenges. It’s chess, but not as you know it.

Includes board, pieces and rules for normal chess.
38764.name: Shuuro

38765.description:
The day has come. The paperwork is complete, the registration filed, and the business cards purchased – you're open for business! So now what? Where do you spend your time? Where do you spend your money? Which tasks are most important? What should take priority? Should you hire new employees? Or maybe invest in a marketing campaign? These are just some of the decisions facing you as a fresh entrepreneur who dreams of running a successful business. You must excel at balancing your time, money and staff because all are scarce and all are required to thrive.

So barter with your fellow colleagues, manage your staff, collect information, expand your office, or schedule your next product shipment. It's up to you – after all, it's your business. Of course, no matter which route you decide to take to reach that corner office at the top of the tallest skyscraper, you must start with everyone else...

...on the Ground Floor!

Over the course of the game, you will:


Convert your employees' time into info, money, and results.
Adapt to changing economic conditions and brace for what's ahead.
Produce, promote, and sell your goods in the marketplace.
Build your company brand through marketing campaigns.
Challenge other players' enterprises for success and prestige.
Grow your business and build your high-rise!
38765.name: Ground Floor

38766.name: Zeugo
38766.description:
Zeugo Table Football (Soccer) is the true successor to the classic game of Subbuteo.

Specially imported from Italy, where it is manufactured by Edilio Parodi, the players are made using the classic Subbuteo 'heavyweight' moulds from the late 1960's. The players are then inserted into modern, flatter bases which give more control and a smoother action. This starter set contains everything required to play the game, including rules in English.
Players bases designed by ProfiBase , the Italian-German company since 1995 leader worldwide in the production of bases for professional table-soccer. With these bases (similar to the model C8, world champion 2005) is very easy to shoot, to slide and to spin. A very good product which has a very big success all over the world and should help Table-Football(Soccer) to have a second birth in the next years

Ages 8 and up

For 2 players or teams

Contents:

Felt pitch
1 Red & white team
1 Blue & white team
2 Balls
2 Goals
Rules

38767.name: El Presidente
38767.description:
El Presidente is a game of forming a Military Junta to run a fictional country. Players use their military power to vote for their preferred El Presidente who then allocates all the other offices in the Junta to the other players. El Presidente then allocates the yearly budget to all the players which they use to purchase armies by auction. However if El Presidente does not keep everybody happy there is likely to be a Coup de Etat.

Required for this game:
Event Deck
Money Deck
Army Deck
Office Cards (reminder rules only)
6 different hats for the government offices

38768.name: The Battle of Crécy
38768.description:
The Hundred Years War

In 1337, based on the strength of his claim to the French throne as a direct descendant of Philip IV
through his mother, Isabella of France, Edward III of England refused to do more than simple (non-liege)
homage for Guyenne to the French King Philip VI.
The resulting war that started shortly afterward between France and England continued, with periodic
truces, until 1453.
The Battle of Crécy, fought on Saturday, August 26, 1346 was the first of several significant battles
during which the longbow triumphed over crossbowmen and armoured knights.

Object of the Game

The Battle of Crécy is a game for two to five players in which you and your opponents play French
knights trying to defeat the Englishmen and to get as much fame and honour as possible while doing so.
Honour is gained by showing off and dispatching English footmen.
The game is played in two separate parts: the night before the battle and the battle itself.
When the battle is done all the player’s fame is counted and the knight whom has gained the most
honour is the winner - even though he might be dead.

38769.name: DICE Quick Play Baseball
38769.description:
DICE Quick Play Baseball is a streamlined version of DICE Baseball (also by Gen1400 Gaming), which allows you to play entire games with the roll of two 10-sided dice. Each game only takes minutes and allows you to play an entire season in a matter of hours.

http://www.gen1400.com/dicebaseball.php

38770.name: Kechukan
38770.description:
Ancient wargame from the Mapuche people of southern Chile.
From the publisher: "The literary translation of this game refers to the 5 sides of the dice made of stone (Kechukawe). Considering that the Mapuches were a warrior people, it is not strange for them to have games, which represented battlefields. This is a game played only by men, who have the counters called Kona (soldiers) to conquer the enemy's field. Chance, which appears when throwing the dice, is nothing else but gods' will which, by the swing of the Kechukawe (or the wheel of fortune, as it might be called today), is indicating the fate of the rival players."

38771.name: Days of the Week
38771.description:
From the front of the box; "See who can reach the picnic first in this exciting race game. A fun way to learn the days of the week and concepts such as week, tomorrow and yesterday."

As you move around the board, you pick up cards with comments such as 'two days ago' and 'Next Saturday'. These move you on to new spaces, when you collect the jigsaw piece for whichever day you have ended up on. Once you have completed the jigsaw, you may start on your way to the picnic.

38772.description:
From the Rulebook:

Mage Knight Conquest provides an entertaining and fast way to play large-scale Mage Knight battles, using castles, artillery pieces and armies created from dozens of battle hungry warriors.
38772.name: Mage Knight Conquest

38775.name: Big Bucks: The World of Business
38775.description:
Equipment:
board
2 dice
6 players' tokens
40 markers
3 gold ingots
15 fortune cards
Title deeds: 3 banks, 4 large corporations, 5 manufacturers, 6 retailers, 7 properties
6 insurance policies
5 paintings
20 stock certificates
Big Bucks Bank paper money

The bottom line: Make your money grow with conservative, moderate risk, and speculative investments. The winner? The player who succeeds in buying out all the other players.

Short Version: Players must settle their debts immediately. Loans from the Big Bucks Bank or between players not permitted.
Long Version: Players may borrow money from the Big Bucks Bank or from other players.

Seems to be a Canadian-centric game; all title deeds are for Canadian cities.

38776.description:
Fourth entry in the Battles of Middle Ages series, featuring the battles of Benevento 1266 AD and Tagliacozzo 1268 AD, opposing the lasts of the Hohenstaufen against Charles of Anjou, champion of the Pope.

Each game comes with a 2A4 full color map and around 100 counters.

Available only as print & play through Wargamesdownloads.com
38776.name: Blonde he was and beautiful: the battles of Benevento and Tagliacozzo

boardgamefamily.4087: TCS Battles of the Middle Ages System

38777.description:
From the publisher:
The Roman empire thrives, conquests and wealth make the city to the capital the world. Countless slaves serve the rich and mingle among the citizens of the city. Envy and murder gain the upper hand and finally the days of the republic seem to be counted as an emperor arises to rule a city and an empire as well.

A new family intervenes in the scheming for power in Rome: The Bruti. Arisen from a tribe subjugated during the time of the founding of Rome the Bruti belong to the oldest patricians in the city. A new party which operates in the shadows to reach their goals and has no scruples to take for themselves what the other families believe to be theirs.
38777.name: Tribune Expansion

boardgamehonor.12805: 2009 Boardgames Australia Awards Best Australian Game Nominee

38778.description:
A board game with nobles rising to power in the Provinces and the Royal courts of 16th-18th century Europe. There is a hierarchy of nobles and players compete to get the best nobles in each area to gain control of countries.

Players collect sets of cards - like Gold, Troops, Dueling Skills, Titles, Castles, Bishop - to raise nobles in four European countries: England, France, Spain and the German States.

There are different paths to victory: getting the first noble in as many provinces as possible, dominating a country, having a noble in every province and capital of a country, getting the full set of 7 different nobles first and having the most of each rank of noble at the end of the game.

Treachery cards are played to remove opponent's nobles and replace them with your own line of nobles: methods include- the guillotine, Spanish Inquisition, the axeman, the gallows and assassinations.
38778.name: Heads of State

38779.name: Mörderische Dinnerparty: Mord in Shanghai
38779.description: A murder mystery party set in the Shanghai of the 30s - a vibrant, multicultural metropolis with two faces. With opium and gambling hat Yu Sheng-Ho, the "Godfather of Shanghai", earned a fortune. In his posh "Shanghai-Club" mixes the illustriously Shanghai Society with the underworld.

38781.description:
Macho Women with Guns is a humorous tactical miniatures game with some RPG elements tacked on for good measure. Players take on the roles of heavily armed women battling everything from Drunken Frat Boys to Bthulhu and more. One player controls the monsters and NPCs while the rest play the women. Characters are created with a point based system governing the stats of Strength, Dexterity, Macho, Looks, and Health. (There is no Intelligence score), as well as various skills like "Run in High Heels" and "Hit Things With Things"...
Combat and skill use is based on a 3d6 roll system combined with double-sided cut-out paper miniatures (cardboard bimbos), and hex boards supplied with the game. Gameplay is quick, easy to learn, and often very absurd.

The game has gone through 3 editions and several expansions.

Expanded by:

Renegade Nuns on Wheels
Batwinged Bimbos from Hell
Macho Women with Guns: The Final Chapter (part one)
More Excuses to Kill Things
38781.name: Macho Women with Guns

38783.name: Vampires' Quest
38783.description: Vampires’ Quest is a fast moving card game for 2 or more players where you and other players compete to bite the most victims. Steal other players’ victims or drive a stake through your opponent’s vampires. Shape change into a wolf and take multiple turns. Protect your victims with coffins. Thwart your opponents’ attacks with mirrors and garlic. Cast fog or turn into a bat! Bite the most victims and win the Vampires’ Quest.

38784.description:
"Firestorm Campaign - Operation Bagration, Russian Front" gives you the tools to recreate the 1944 Soviet offensive in Byelorussia.
